resources.string: Please take a moment to configure the Salaat times to your requirements.

By default Salaat times are configured using Muslim World League calculation method, Shafii Juristic for Asr time calculations and makes no adjustment for people living in higher latitudes.

 Other calculation methods include: Karachi, ISNA, Makkah, Egypt, Tehran, Jafri

 You can choose to use the default settings (don't worry you can change them later), or configure the Salaat times to your requirements below.
Please select the calculation method for Salaat in your area. Muslim World League should work for most people.
Shafii is the standard most often used. Please select the method that best suits you. If you are not sure, leave Shafii selected, you can always change it later.
ISNA - Islamic Society of North America
EGYPT - Egyptian General Authority of Survey
TEHRAN - Institute of Geophysics, University of Tehran

For people living in higher latitudes, the prayer times can be incorrect. If the prayer times seem incorrect, try changing this value.\n\n During the summer months One-Seventh method produces a later Fajr time than Angle based method. If you perfer Angle based method, please change below.

This feature uses the compass in your phone to point you in the correct direction. The compass can be unreliable indoors so if the results look incorrect, we recommend orienting your phones compass by performing the following steps.
Your location is used to calculate Salaat times.\n Click \'Okay\' to grant permission to access your location.
Your location in GPS coordinates is used to calculate Salaat times.\n Without this, Salaat times will not be visible.
Kaaba locator requires Google Maps which requires permission to write to external storage.\n\n If you click \'continue\', you will be prompted to grant permissions to write to external storage.
alarm interrupted by an other app or phone call.
Volume starts off low and increases every 10 seconds to gently wake you up.
Be notified before Suhoor or Iftar and display prayers in the alarm screen.\nThis option is only available if alarm is turned on.
Play Adhan instead of alarm ringtone
وَبِصَوْمِ غَدٍ نَّوَيْتَ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ
Wa bi-sawmi ghadin nawaytu min shahri ramadan
I intend to keep the fast for tomorrow in the month of Ramadan.
\u200F اِنِّى لَكَ صُمْتُ وَبِكَ امنْتُ وَ عَلى رِزْقِكَ اَفْطَرْتُ
Allahumma Inni laka sumtu wa bika amantu [wa alayka tawakkalto] wa ‘ala rizqika aftartu
O Allah! I fasted for You and I believe in You and I break my fast with Your sustenance
